GmBoDNC0dMmChmpHzZIPOg.text: No reason to avoid the place, but don't go out of your way unless you're already at Harrod's and hankering for a pick-me-up.The scones are pretty nice, a little sweet, buttery and soft with a toasty crunch to the outside, and the service is gracious, patient and accommodating. We stayed for something like 3 hours just nibbling and sipping. It's just the atmosphere that needs some oomph. The place has kind of a cafeteria-like feel, a barrenness that is surprising given the amount of detail put into everything else at Harrod's. Its not off-putting exactly, but just not the cute cozy setting you might be hoping for with tea. That being said, on a rainy day after some moseying around the fancy department store, nothing is more appropriate than a break for cream tea!

fICjzu7h-uoyMJ4x3wMOyQ.text: God Save the Queen... and the Clotted Cream!!!  Clotted Cream, Jam and Scones, a true institution of England.  Harrods tea room is overpriced, but convient if you are spending the day shopping. These scones are a little crunchy, a little crumbly and a little sweet, just the right combination for a scone.  Not too dry, but dry enough that you will welcome the Cream and Jam. Really the scone is just a delivery mechanism for the Clotted Cream. The more the better. The tea is lovely.  Everything is served on a proper china, as it should be.  You have to "take tea" while in London, and this is the perfect place to do it!!!

mbKbpP8ElJlTk6_KZ1KrfA.text: The wife and I stopped here in the afternoon to drink some tea in the store's second floor tea room (by the luggage department).  We did not have the full tea, just two pots of tea with milk.  The first thing we noticed is that the staff were extremely busy.  The manager made sure the waiters were hopping, even confronting two employees when one paused so he could help the other with making an entry into the register.  But there were either too many patrons or too few waiters.  I had to wait 15 minutes just to have our waiter in eyesight to flag him down and then it would take up to half an hour to get ones order.Secondly, probably because it was a Monday and they had been "cleaned out" over the weekend, they were out of half the teas in their list of options.  I tried an earthy Chinese black tea and my wife had Assam, which she has had before.Third, my wife's milk container had a leak.  We did not need any more milk; she shared mine.  But really 45 minutes just to get someone to remove a container from our table because it was leaking milk over the table top is unacceptable.The booth behind us (with four people) had ordered proper afternoon tea and the servers paid much more attention to them making sure they had multiple orders of sandwiches, hot scones, and pastries, plus champagne.  It is obvious where the staff prioritize their time.  Still if you're parched after exploring the store for an hour or more, this is your best bet to get a fresh pot of tea.

xk8cTt1lqdBw83UCGLMl1g.text: What a delightful little bucket list item! A friend suggested I do "tea time" at Harrods while visiting London and it just so happened that I happened upon the world famous department store as I was walking towards Cromwell Road. Getting to the tea room proved to be something that should be reserved for "The Amazing race" show, but that's only because the store is sooo big! It was almost comical how many store employees we had to ask for directions and how many times we got lost, regardless of them. I figured there would be a wait to be seated, but were able to get a 2-person table right away. Thank goodness, because after all that walking, I really needed to rest my heels. Not being tea-drinkers, we asked our server for a suggestion and in her super cool British accent she giddily said "Oh! Most definitely the french vanilla!! It's delightful!" She was obviously a fa - which had us sold. We also ordered crumpets, not knowing what they are (think English muffins) and not caring. When in Rome...(buy leather goods. When in England, but tea and crumpets). The restaurant itself was decorated beautifully, like a room that you'd find in Windsor Castle. I felt like royalty (or a distance offspring of it); being served our tea and crumpets on fine china with silver place settings and pot. The fancy, complimentary chocolate mints that came with our bill was a very nice touch. It was all the niceties of the tea room that made our hour long visit so incredibly enjoyable.

zNwg7lrxIoPx492ZAKcLbA.text: This was my first time in London as an adult and first time having "afternoon tea" with a friend of mine. We were going to go to the Georgian which was a more upscale tea room also in Harrod's, but of course it was full without reservations. It all worked out in the end since we ended up in the Tea Room which was just as nice and much cheaper compared to the Georgian.We ordered the Mayfair which was a package with choice of tea and a tower of delicious tea goodies which included scones, biscuits sandwichs and tea cakes. The jasmine tea we ordered was amazing -it had a strong jasmine fragrance and I've grown up drinking jasmine tea. The only downside was there was a bit of a wait time and I don't believe they take reservations as it's a bit more casual. But overall, I would definitely come back and recommend to anyone going to London.

1FN3-FKJ4Hci8uuuSbEszA.text: Beautiful tearoom and nice chandeliers.  Great, lovely friendly service.  The tea service was very nice.  I'm only rating it 3 stars because the food was good but not phenomenal.  Good one time experience only...

CY1_HL7ARjBqDOIzAhLa9w.text: The worst tea and accompanying milk, for, get this; £5!!. The sandwich too, very, very ordinary, also terribly overpriced. The afternoon tea at The Ritz was totally worth it at £45; but this is money truly wasted.

I298_7R-p4XlIwKoKnZmMw.text: Loved it. Got the two scones and tea combo ("the Barcley").  You really cannot go wrong here.

uDcrVEwiT3qbdwoMIUFERw.text: For the atmosphere in Harrods', I would easily give it a five star, the "high tea" experience itself with the services are really nice. But this might also be why I give it a rating down to a three star... I expected much much more for the price... I am not saying that I don't like the food and tea, or they are not good, but frankly, there are improvements they can made to strike for better. The presentation of the TEA SET isn't  quite perfect, as we have ordered two sets for five of us,and they basically just piled up everything into one cupcake tower rack only. Still, I must say, I enjoyed spending time there with my aunties and friends, immersing ourselves in this luxurious and elegant ladies' time. Plus, the scones with the cream and jam are really real comfort food:)

5BF-WMGZ0PPErKiweSJQEg.text: Was pleasantly surprised with my visit to the Harrod's Tea Room.  It was unfortunately very busy and we had to queue for about 20+ minutes to get a table.  The decor was appropriate and well maintained. The service was friendly and professional but not entirely attentive.  The prices were about what I expected, not unbearable expensive.  The quality of the food was better, our party of 4 ordered a wide varieties of items. The items varied slightly from our expectation, there is no description listed with any items in the menu.  The "chicken pot pie" was deconstructed, but still very good, the fruit salad was actually a very large parfait, but the crumpets were delicious. The tea/coffee were both very good.Overall a good experience.

bza_H5ZCLtRHX33zpdp1ww.text: Lovely tea and smashing salted caramel cake.  Nice place to people watch all the wanna be rich, the rich and other people.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

6IODaJT6_tlBlVqvOhmQXw.text: Great service, drinks and food.  Our family of 7 had a wonderful meal here after a long and hot day of touring the sites in  London.   Of course, we also had tea and pastries.  The pastries are amazing....but the lunch food was also very good and high quality.

pIZ4EGenacxEd6Zxk86xiw.text: I've satisfied English tea craving! Best tiramisu cake ever and harrods tea selections are really great! Makes sure to try few desserts

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

1w04__V6NAlRCjVl2fvKxw.text: Being Harrods you'd expect perfection. I've been here several time and every time the experience has been sub par. The service is extremely poor considering the high standard Harrods pride themselves on. The waiters aren't attentive; very slow and seem extremely miserable.The scones are ok, but I've had much better (I'd recommend going to the Wolsey very close by)The one positive is the tea selection is very vast.

QiuU6uAc0B_hPhFjtVbkGg.text: On the second floor of world famous Harrod's, the Tea Room features Wedgewood settings and all the tasty bits of a proper afternoon tea joint.  It's not the best because it's almost assembly line style service starting with a queue outside.  The dining room is small and the tables are ugly but the food quality is fine and the service is good.  The matcha dome cake looks so good but it was too lemony for my taste.  I recommend the cheesecake or the Napoleon.  Traditional English Breakfast was my tea of choice and it was as good as can be.  If you're in the massive Harrod's store and want more than just a Starbucks or Pret a Manger for an afternoon snack, find this gem in the rear of the store on the second floor near the crocodile luggage.

vnUmZqGlOxGaXePRphcAlQ.text: Visiting Harrods was on my to-do list in London.  Wish I had had more time to wander around and shop but I'm content with just having had tea in The Tea Room.  Our server was really helpful with recommendations of teas and tea fancies. Everything we had was simple and delicious (smoked salmon sandwich, root vegetable soup, tea-cured Scottish salmon, Banoffee pie bomb, Victoria sandwich, peach melba choux, and a few others I cannot recall).  This place is really nice, what a fun experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

rBg88HJVKT8xOwKvyWF8Wg.text: okay tea room and good service. as it was inside harrods i expected a bit more, but the crew was pleasant. the food was ok and not too pricey. the scones and cream were delicious. a good spot to rest for an hour after a long day of shopping!

F6sn1T5wO8TGlyUDcZSy_w.text: I ordered vanilla excellent tea with milk. My first vanilla tea, tasted great. Service was nice, lots of staff about. The decoration is very pretty and the venue is well lit. I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla excellent tea with milk

vAwGPJiaCVdlZq24Ki3bjw.text: Had tea time here with a friend, and we each got our own wee pot of tea, and 5 tea fancies we picked from a list of 12, so we tried 10 in all. Absolutely brilliant!The tiny tiny desserts were all really very good. I'm not sure which was my fave. But my least fave was the fruit cake. Service was nice enough and not bougie at all, even though I was an American tourist and I'm sure that was annoying in and of itself. It was fun to indulge for a day... will be back next time. Cheers mate!

3aDvk0NJfwj4NJfM8LXZMg.text: Really nice environment!English breakfast was tasty,but could be bigger? Citrus thingy dessert was nice, but too be honest I prefer Laduree more...more visually satisfying...

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast & citrus dessert

HA6TD0UXvGruczWzR4bfIA.text: This was our first stop when arriving to London from the NY tri-state area. Did some shopping and had a lovely brunch at the Tea Room. I always wanted to do this with Mr. and we did. Service was very good and friendly. I loved the Wedgwood china. We ordered the chicken tarragon pie and quiche of the day, both did not disappoint. The lovely experience I was looking for. Can't wait to return.

5KGfiNzXZn2O8AQJCkEC4w.text: The tearoom is a hidden gem; hidden in the sense you need to navigate throughout the large department store to find this place behind the luggage department.  I had the afternoon tea that was delicious.  Followed by the stuffed tomatoes, which was just average in flavor.  We had the white rose for dessert and that was delicious.  Service was good and the place itself had a relaxing ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. White English rose
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea

GjFqkWeGq54hBdfb8dsIhw.text: My friends and I wanted to try English afternoon tea for the first time and decided to choose this place because they do not require reservations ever. I went here on a Sunday afternoon around 3:39 PM in a group of 8. We were seated after a 10-15 minute wait which I consider to be very quick for no reservation and a busy time. However, we were seated in the ONE awkward table they had that was a large round circle with a bouquet on top so i couldn't see my friend across from me. Looking around, however, this is the only table in the entire restaurant so it is more bad luck, but really, they should just get rid of this infuriating table.Anyways, our waitress was very kind and friendly. Most of us chose The Mayfair option which was 29 pounds for five half sandwiches, two scones, three tiny desserts of our choice, and one pot of tea from a selection. It was super filling! I would definitely say skip lunch if you get The Mayfair and you'll end up skipping dinner too. The sandwiches are absolutely delicious. The chicken one is currently floating in my dreams. The chef accidentally added roast beef to a salmon sandwich which sounds nice, but my vegetarian friend was not amused. The scones are AMAZING. With the clotted cream and jam, they will fill you right up especially if you drink your entire pot of tea. The tea fancies are actually very very tiny, but by the time you get to the third tier, you'll be so full anyway! The Lime & Pineapple dessert I had was a little too sweet and sour.However, it was still a very rewarding and satisfying experience! If they just get rid of that table, they could easily get five stars in my head.

ABZbKrAy4LIvwNJZ2De2Fg.text: Really love this place. I like taking tea here instead of the usual cafe place. It's quite classy and usually more chilled. The tea selection is quite extensive and amazing. I love having classy tea for a fiver :)

cahV2twnZx8Vv281Vo29Cg.text: One of the best teas in London. Splurge and get the champagne tea. Treat yourself to a glass of bubbly before the sandwiches, scones, desserts, and tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. The Experience!

x3DmrYqs0GGMK26YFyUt2A.text: It's easy to get swept into the hype of Harods. But really it's more like another consumer trap. I've had nicer Afternoon tea experiences. This place is really busy. the seating is tight it's not a very roomy luxurious space. The food. Desserts although very beautiful are very sweet as expected but the cakes are very dry. Scones are fresh and Large. You could really just have a scone with tea and be set. The Savories that came with the afternoon tea were also quite sweet. After it all it's just another food court.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon Tea
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Tea Room
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Desserts

5QpACcpfnx3AZ59OyD6svQ.text: If I could give it zero stars I would.  I have been to Harrods many times since childhood.  We went the other day for a quick cup of tea and a small fancy. 1. The cutlery we were provided was inappropriate.  We were given dinner forks when we should have been given desert forks. 2. The spoons for both our cups had residue on them from previous use; along with lipstick on mine.  3. The back of my fork had dirt along the back side. We mentioned this to the server who was a bit polite but wanted to know what we wanted as that was our reason for bringing this up.Rather it was us pointing it out as to prevent scenes or issues with future customers and to point out that clearly there was something wrong with their dishwasher.  In the end they removed their service charge which was insulting.  In the end, I will never be returning to Harrods to shop or dine.  The store is looking run down and tired compared to past years.  I will stick to Selfridges especially after this event.

j-dJIFtbKTdepUqMEvQAWw.text: Second time here and still elegant... a delightful experience. Located on the 4th floor behind the largest jewelry collection ever, not much has changed except the cucumber sandwiches... where are they? Tea, sandwiches, scones, pastries all tops. But be careful... your SO may want a diamond tiara from the jewelry dept. on the way out.

GsCn8MO-oDXhRz-uD8YS3w.text: On the day before Christmas, all other restaurants have expected long wait line beside the tea room. Ordered the Mayfair afternoon tea for four with our choice of cake. The food was only mediocre at the price of 29 per person. A 3 star is well deserved. Better off to some other places! (Ps: the scones were dry and hard)

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Mayfair afternoon tea with exotic fruit pastry

yTJJgBs-qsJxzlQqmBzBJA.text: The food was delicious- the service, absolutely abysmal. I made a reservation online to have afternoon tea on The Terrace. Upon arrival, I was informed in the most condescending tone that tea is only served in the main dining room. Not wanting to make a fuss, I don't push  the issue, but then am asked by every server I encounter whether I'm sure I want the CLASSIC afternoon tea. The waitress who brings out my tea, sandwiches, and scones is very friendly, but once she brings out the last tray of food she disappears. It then takes a full 55 minutes of asking passing servers and eventually walking up to the front desk to get my leftovers wrapped up and my check brought out. The man at the front desk (who has been wordlessly watching all this for at least 45 minutes) eventually saunters over with my check without any sort of apology. Nobody comes to afternoon tea for the overpriced finger sandwiches- at 60 pounds ($90) after "optional"/ not-actually-optional service fees, one would expect diners to at least be treated with basic politeness.

Kmy8L9wrJnltOK6Fiq3kmw.text: So HARRODS itself is phenomenal what an incredible experience.  I loved the ambiance of the tea room.  The tea was perfect and the delicate desserts were well crafted and full of flavor.  The room itself was surprisingly very loud and the service was good nothing special.  The dishes are all Floral and match the tea theme.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Matcha Dessert and English Rose  tea
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

ieZPL0JVzWvFxDQXjorqZA.text: I was pleasantly surprised that this tea room was available without reservation! Maybe we got lucky but we were shopping around Harrods and decided to try to see if the tea room had anything available for 4. We were immediately seated. The decor is very much consistent with tea time- tea cups and matching plates everywhere, beautiful soft colors and small seating areas and benches. I was in love at first sight! We went just for afternoon tea, not food, but there is a very good menu if you're looking for that. Each of us ordered a different tea and different dessert. Everything was spectacular! Tea biscuits, scones, crumpets and the chocolate cake were all so delectable, so were the teas! I had the vanilla and I couldn't stop drinking it. I 100% recommend this tea room, you will not regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate cake!
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Tea for four!

BJglIcStmaYqL3WeEQUWkw.text: For a taste of High Tea in London, you have to stop by Harrods. We were here for an afternoon and we're lucky enough to make it and it did not disappoint. I recommend an Indian Spiced Chai to help provide some nice balance to the meal. We split one between two people and it was perfect.

YKdw9KKfbrQ81c62CkLtMw.text: Very nice experience, pricey but nice. The tea and champagne were fantastic. They serve salad with caviar And Shrimp. Then you get small plates of sandwiches, egg, turkey and beef. A lot of small deserts and macaroons . Followed by biscuits. I was stuffed at the end of the 3 hour hours. Everyone should experience this once

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

5ElHQ7XubL23GscwSwX_Ag.text: This place is a bit pricey but worth the splurge. My husband and I stopped here twice on our recent London trip and opted for tea and dessert. The first time trying the Oolong tea and the second trying the Early Grey. Both were so good and served in the cutest tea cups.I am not much of a dessert person but they looked so good we had to try them. We opted for the Napolean and the chocolate bar and I was blown away by the quality and flavor of each dessert. They were amazing and I want to go back to London just to have them again!When visiting Harrods make sure you stop by the tea room!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Napolean dessert and delicious Earl grey tea

VDizOZvYKywJFt7XG-TvWw.text: If your ever in London, go to The world famous Harrods! It's full of brands your not going to be able to afford, but the building is beautiful and the experience of walking the is amazing! The tea room was beautiful, with great pastries and AMAZING TEA!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful decorations
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. The Tea Room

C8siSF7t39kDz7Abr5Xgxg.text: Great food selection with tea, optional high tea or a la cart. Usual dress code. Locations on the second floor near the pizzeria and milk bar.

s_J7vzlWbm6PjStahi7ZaA.text: Love, love, loved afternoon tea here.  Served in wedgewood set.  The best scone and clotted cream I've ever had.  I regret that I didn't buy clotted cream to bring back to the states.  I will definitely go back when I am in London next time.  Can't wait!!

kH_-R1qYDXnxtSO2Wyegxg.text: The scones and sandwiches were OK, and  could  be  better  if  the  scones  can  be  warm. Asking  for  more  scones  and  sandwiches  would  cause  extra  charge. The  China  was  beautiful. You can choose a  dessert  from  the  counter and  mine  tasted  good.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

q5AT_1KGZQzfWop8vrKzqA.text: Nothing too special here.  The tea and scones were nice.  The special quiche was good, but for the price you can definitely do better (see my other tea room reviews)For location and to say you ate at Harrods' I guess is the main draw.

GpvGOQFcx0G-e4Zv4zsJIQ.text: Howard's tea room was a great experience for myself and my family. There is an extensive tea menu and the desserts are delectable. The tea comes in full regalia on Wedgwood China. The crumpets are delicious and warm and come with a variety of jams.

QdkPMAlB7KdjN2vX9EAlzQ.text: My friend and I enjoyed an afternoon tea with champagne while in London. The sandwiches and pastries were all delicious and surprisingly filling. It is pricy, as expected, but you are certainly paying for the experience and presentation. The dining area is gorgeous. The servers were elegantly dressed and professional. Harrods' is a landmark, so even the men opening doors in top hats and green Cinderella-esque coats were impressive to me. It should be a slow-paced, relaxing afternoon, so I recommend allotting at least two hours for the tea (and many more hours to explore the food court at Harrods'). Make reservations in advance or you will be waiting awhile for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea service at Harrods'

hXEk3nLagd4fNa1MxwS58A.text: Overall, I love Harrod's the store, and Harrod's Tea Room was a nice way to end our shopping trip. We did not get afternoon tea, but ordered al a cart instead. Other than the fact that when you first walk in it is ambiguous as to who to talk to for a table, service was excellent. The tea was good, and the food was delicious. We got a caramel type dessert cake to end everything, and it was a sweet way to end the night.

hUbtb5VG75GI2s3mtYNh9Q.text: At least a 15 minute wait. Staff not friendly or very helpful. After finally getting seated had to wait over another 15 minutes before waiter coming to get order. Food was not very tasty and tea was weak.  The location was good and the decorations was very beautiful. Definitely overpriced.

7rZygwzikyTHYDLtxfWKwA.text: Had a great time splurging and taking my daughter here for high tea.  It was a big hit.We ordered two and should have split just one.  The amount of food was more than enough with one.

Q7e8Tj-gJHWzn1RxnXgA0A.text: The tea room is located on the 2nd floor of what may be the best department store in the world!  It is bustling and busy.  Great to sit and rest aching feet of you have done every floor as I have.   The scones receive 4 stars, the tea also.   Just far too crowded to be in the same category of the Ritz or Dorchester.     When I asked the server which tea she recommended she responded with, "I don't drink tea!"    Ok?   So, not for high tea (to which they overprice given the service and lack of luster) But I'd recommend this place if you just need a quick bite or a sweet pastry.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. This is the tower of treats.   Sandwiches were on the dry side.  Scones fabulous and I drank too much tea to try Dessert.
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

xYHDjykTxF7YCJRM6bcjqQ.text: Very nice spot for tea - go hungry the food is great. We enjoyed the tea sandwiches as well as the clotted cream and scones. The earl grey was excellent as was the service. A bit pricey but worth doing at least once.

FHau7bDUY-2u2PZRWlKmDg.text: Absolutely lovely and charming tea room.  Had a very nice experience and the finger sandwiches, tea, and scones were all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

EuTOfztr8Xee_gUNYu_v2g.text: The service was friendly here and the food was all excellent. The tea selection was wonderful as well. A little expensive but would recommend the experience to anyone who enjoys going to tea. My favorite part was the egg sandwiches and the scones! I almost would've had extra scones over the chocolate tart! But the tart was beautiful to look at.

eStxLVqiysNEh91EHf1WBA.text: When in London, go for High Tea! This is a lifetime experience- a bit pricey, but on par for all high tea houses.  Everything comes in little trays.  I enjoyed this solo (at the end of a work trip) and it was amazing! Sandwiches - the cucumber sammie was a bit squishy at the bottom (it'd been fridged for a bit too long) Egg salad with the truffle butter Top was OUTRAGEOUSLY delicious! The great part is that will give you a refill of sandwiches! DRINKS:I got the rose tea - a bit delicate, but really flavorful.  Get the 10 pound upgrade for champagne!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Desserts to die for!
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Lovely way to spend a Saturday afternoon in London! Worth the money! (65 pounds w/champagne)

tiWXU3-YrzRWx11TWzCs7Q.text: Harrods' Tea Room was the first that I visited in London.Although the online site states many dress code rules and etiquette tips for people to follow, in person, Harrods' and their employees do not hold customers to that standard. People were dressed extremely casually and the ambiance of the restaurant was surprisingly loud.However, the tea, service, and food are incredible. I decided to get the afternoon tea which came with endless sandwiches, desserts, and tea, and it was definitely worth the price. I was able to get an incredible experience with my family.If a friend were to be looking for a stereotypical tea room experience with the posh vibes, I would be hesitant to recommend Harrods' Tea Room. However, for anyone who is looking for a great meal or a casual date place, I definitely enjoyed Harrods'!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

5JE5iwUrrrrQx4Y8wF9KUA.text: If you are into expensive, but delicious cakes, the the Harrods Tea Room is for you.We had their carrot cake and the loaf of bread with salted butter. Both were very yummy, however, unless you are really hungry, the cake can easily be shared by two people. Same goes for the bread.Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Carrot cake - really awesome!!!

wNujPm_Wpj-OTVKwqvTWtA.text: I don't understand the five star reviews. Horrible service, pastries were below average, tea was the only decent thing. Unforgettable experience for all the wrong reasons. If you're looking for the ultimate tea experience, you definitely will not find it here.

jRS92wyXagzBCL2T4skZNA.text: Super cute tea room. Even though this tea room was expensive, it was quite the experiences. The crumpets were delicious!

J_X4YC5QKiJHmjEVjrJ49g.text: This is consistently one of my lost lovely experiences when Im visiting London. I think my first tea was about a decade ago and I've made several most stops since. My last was on Mother's Day (US date not UK date) and I was able to bring my mom this time! Our service was as always impeccable and the tea perfect. The jazz quartet was excellent. Thank you for providing such a memorable experience for our holiday.

Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

fOc7js7jGU5my3ZKNHUjIg.text: My sister and I went to London with my BFF and my niece. We enjoyed the tea at the Savoy so much that we decided to have tea at Harrods too. Harrods has one of the best tea rooms in London. The sandwiches are beautiful and delicious. In addition to the standard tearoom sandwiches there is a selection for all types of diets. My sister has a severe food allergy and the servers were very attentive to her needs. Harrods gives you unlimited sandwiches and has a wide selection of sweets and teas. Definitely a great place to experience tea for any type of celebration and for everyday.

4dhWFt10097J9YAMZJgIHQ.text: Perfect place for traditional tea and pastries I like the way feel like old English ambiance I would recommend for everyone who has tea culture

O5qKZoNO52XLgFze0u1nog.text: Lifetime experience. I have heard a lot of criticism against the Harrods' Tea Room that its overrated. Wrong -- its everything that they say it is! the food was great the service was impeccable. if you save up you must do this when you come to London

5sApbStLEojwCuPVfg7Lng.text: The best afternoon tea experience we had in london was in Harrods Tea room. The decor is so beautiful the service is excellent price per person is for Afternoon Tea is 55 pounds or 65 pounds with Harrods special Champagne. We tried the Georgian Blend tea that was recommended by our waiter and was an excellent choice that went well with sweet and savory pastries and sandwiches. I am not s butter person but the butter and house made jam with warm scones were amazing. Last year we did not have a reservation so we could not wait for an hour. But this year we had plenty of time to wait and enjoy. Next time i am going to try their lunch or dinner menu items for sure. Highly recommend this place after shopping. Its right next to mezza restaurant. Till next time .....

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

Qfvd5XG5DT3taLm_az8Ipw.text: Needed some ME time away from the family. They decided to go to Harry Potter studios last minute. I had planned of going to a tea time all along. The Orangery at the Kensington Palace was the actual plan but unfortunately it didn't work out due to high demand. But despite that, was determined to make it happened!   After a couple hours roaming around Harrods, plugged my mobile into the free wifi and had Yelp guide me through to see who offers tea time with such simplistic with a bang.   And guess what came up...Harrods' Tea Room.  Oh my Lordy, this little spot didn't disappoint at all. Wasted no time and placed my order after I waited for 5 minutes in line to be seated.Rooibos tea was my choice of drinks... has a soft and tangy flavour which combines a dry straw earthiness with a hint of bitter Seville oranges. Tip: adding brown sugar or any sugar looses the appeal of its natural bitterness.English crumpets- toasted and served with preserve ; butter and orange marmalade... delish!English tea cakes- halved and toasted; butter alone was enough to add a hint of sweetness. Fantastic...!Server was quick, attentive, and above all quite lovely, indeed! Fair pricing being at Harrods...who knew?... and yes, all the fancy China was used to truly gives you the feeling of dining with her Majesty.  Highly recommend it.Fancy a spot o' tea?

ZLlHXQCoU9cW7vArNl_AZQ.text: Lovely venue. Flavorful sandwiches. Champagne was a lovely addition to the delicious array of flavor filled  sandwiches  and desserts. Wow - just shocking how casual tea is here- babies crying, jeans & tea shirts.

Sd9O03gcuYR4JPZ9pURybg.text: The service was almost non-existent!  The experience I was told by friends to expect sadly never arrived.  I really wanted to like this place especially considering the price of £55.  Was told over the phone when making the reservation that I would be able to try an assortment of teas, but in actuality the limit was 2.  I think next time I will spend my money at The Ritz for afternoon tea.  Not sure if this made a difference, but I was told by the staff that they have changed afternoon tea experience at Harrod's in May 2018.  Sadly it was not for the better.  Now it's the same price but less quality.

jyFFWYbxACPSBg5kaKnWAw.text: I have no idea how this place got the reviews it did, or why it is so popular (the place was very crowded and had long waits, though this is not the point of my review).  So it was my birthday and we decided that we wanted a special high tea.  As we always do, we looked up on Yelp a good place for it (our originally desired place, Swan, was sold out for weeks).  Harrod's came up with good reviews, so we wanted to try it,  and since it was my birthday we didn't really care about the 4 $ sign; we wanted the best.Harrod's itself was neat to walk around; the jeweler was pretty and it felt very artistic.  We laughed a little at the high price of the average looking handbags and saw their excellent sweet shop and such.  So having to wait for a table turned out to actually be pleasurable.Much worse can be said for the high tea experience.  For reference, we ordered two High Teas; mine vegetarian, my wive's not.  We paid the 10 extra pounds for the champagne round, making the total cost of the high tea 65 pounds per person (with tip the final bill was $190 after conversion; or 143 pounds).The first thing we noticed was our waitress was quite rude.  Far from the high-class experience we desired, she was curt and short with us, always hurrying.  They looked understaffed, so I can understand that to a degree, but if you are looking for a high-class experience you expect much better.  This alone would have been enough for a poor review; but there was more (and, in fairness, the other waiters and waitresses we flagged down seemed much more helpful; our waitress never returned except to deliver foods otherwise).The sandwiches were, in a word, horrible.  You get 4 small slivers of sandwich, which I guess for a high tea is "standard" (combined they might add up to 2/3rds of a full sandwich).  So the issue was A) they were stale and B) They were terribly unimaginative.  I wanted unique chef dishes, what I got were some stale cucumber pieces and such.  Which was far better than my wife, who found her meat sandwiches completely unpalatable.The tea was OK; my wife said hers tasted like Lipton.  I love tea, but these were bland; for having a "special blend hand crafted by a tea master", they sure tasted like standard green and black teas.  Nothing unique or particularly impressive here.The deserts were a little better, but not much.  The scones were actually quite good, and had a very tasty homemade jam that went on them... truly the meal's highlight.  The rest... each of us had a banana bread that we took 1 bite from... like the sandwiches, they were stale and tasteless.  The mouse bite was pretty nice, and there was a raspberry jello-Like dessert that was, while not good, at least an attempt at being different.  A nice  tarte, a bad lemon mouse, and some other forgettable bites.Overall, our 2nd most expensive meal of our lives turned out to be a forgettable experience worse than our basic $20/person high teas in Atlanta.  Even the decor is not terribly good; nothing either high class or modern about it.  We decided to not complain (who wants the drama); and promised ourselves to post a review to warn others away from our mistake.  Try Swan house if you want a high tea; we got an unforgettably delicious dinner there, and regretted not booking a tea there as well.

cJSn27spssAfYhPZkkbGWQ.text: I was craving clotted, cream and scones during my London visit. Harrods did not disappoint delicious clotted cream and scones top that with superior service, I complimented and sweetened my cup of  tea with my  naturevia stevia.   Best tasting Stevia in the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

llPZftiEkTfoeqrbi-o3RA.text: If you haven't made reservations for afternoon tea in The Harrods Tea Rooms on the Fourth Floor, and you would just have a meal, you can eat on the terrace. (Tea is not served on the Terrace.) It is a quiet area with a roof-top view of Knightsbridge. The service is super-slow but it is a nice place to have a cocktail and something to eat in peace and away from the chaos of the rest of the store. The class British food is made from British ingredients and served the same menu as The Tea Room,  is priced on the higher end (which is expected) and it is decent...not outstanding. A 10% service charge is automatically added to your bill. restaurant@harrods.com or harrods.com

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

O6cINCNrD0IRMz6uUAT6RA.text: I didn't want to miss out on having afternoon tea in London during my very short first visit, and I'm happy that we had our first taste of it here at Harrod's! My husband and I shared "The Wedgewood" option on the menu. It was £32 and it included tea, a selection of finger sandwiches, scones served with clotted cream and assorted jams, and your choice of one sweet delight from their menu. We found it to be a great deal for the price. The finger sandwiches were tasty, my favorite being one that had salmon. But can we talk about the scones with clotted cream?!? Clotted cream FTW! Harrod's is a magical store! I'll definitely be back for tea and for shopping!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom

PY-HI-M8mBaTH43tCfptbg.text: I love the tea here! I had earl grey with cream and sugar and ordered and it was amazing. Probably the best I've had in a long time. I went alone for some me time and it's not as loud of a place you'd expect Harrods to be. The service was fast waited maybe 2-3 minutes at most for my tea. If I'm ever in London again I will for sure come back here.

vMeTL-WvjG_MlIkv-LcE4w.text: This was my first high tea experience and I absolutely loved it. I've nothing to compare it to but I enjoyed every minute. For £35 pounds you get the 'Wedgwood' which gets you 6 sandwiche wedges, a pastry, tea. 2 scones, 4 mini jars of Jams, and some clotted cream. Every bit of the high tea is delicious. Yummiest finger sandwiches and pastries. The scones are fresh and the clotted cream with jams are a delight. Wonderful customer service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea - 2 roast beef, 2 salmon and 2 egg sandwiches. 2 scones with clotted cream and the strawberry pistachio fraiser pastry.
Photo of Harrods' Tea Room - London, United Kingdom. Harrods Darjeeling and Earl Grey Tea

u-et2StETf94Mz0x6QuhYA.text: This was my very first British Afternoon tea.  You need a reservation, but it is a good place to try it and do shopping as well
